title.rendered: ‘Fake Mr. Bean ‘Videos are viral after Zimbabwe’s win in the T20 World cup match

content.rendered:
They Sent ‘Fake Mr. Bean’, and Zimbabwe replied with a Victory

On 27 Oct 2022, Zimbabwe defeated Pakistan by 1 run withinside the T20 World Cup 2022 clash. Many Zimbabwe enthusiasts had termed it a `revenge fit’ as Pakistan had despatched a ‘Fake Mr. Bean’ to their USA. Pakistan’s 1-run defeat in opposition to Zimbabwe withinside the T20 World Cup 2022 on Thursday has brought on a plethora of reactions on social media. Twitterati is on the peak of this since yesterday.

Surprisingly for the ones unaware, loads of those reactions revolve around Mr. Bean, the identical man or woman British actor Rowan Atkinson popularised. Even earlier than the fit had started, sure tweets from Zimbabwe enthusiasts over sending a ‘Fake Mr. Bean’ to their USA had flooded the internet. After Zimbabwe defeated Pakistan on Thursday, many extra tweets and movies have surfaced. Some of those movies even display the ‘Fake Mr. Bean’ interacting with enthusiasts in Zimbabwe.

 Who is the ‘Fake Mr. Bean’ or ‘Pak Bean’?

In the recent past, Pakistan had deliberately sent ‘Fake Mr. Bean’. The guy who portrayed the man or woman Rowan Atkinson as soon as popularised is Pakistani comic Asif Muhammad. He turned into the only one who posed because of the duplicate of the authentic Mr. Bean all through his go to Zimbabwe. The enthusiasts in Zimbabwe have been angry.

The jokes over ‘Fake Mr. Bean’ went viral to a volume that even the president of Zimbabwe, Emmerson Mnangagwa, took to Twitter and wrote, “What a win for Zimbabwe! Congratulations to the Chevrons. Next time, ship the actual Mr. Bean”.  This message from Mnangagwa precipitated a response from Pakistan Prime Minister, Shahbaz Sharif, who wrote: “We might not have the actual Mr. Bean; however, we’ve got actual cricketing spirit. And we Pakistanis have a humorous addiction to bouncing back. Mr. President, Congratulations. Your crew performed properly today.”

Since yesterday, social media and especially Twitter is at its peak for all these memes and viral videos.

Read more: T20 World Cup 2022: Surya Kumar Yadav’s funny comment during the post-game presentation
